p: China is now the world’s biggest producer and consumer of food products, including meat, and factory farms there are growing in number and size.4 Brazil is among the world’s leading producers and exporters of meat—including beef, chicken, and pork—and of soybeans, a prime component of feed for farmed animals (corn is another).5 India’s poultry industry is largely industrialized, and India has the world’s largest herds of cows and buffaloes. Although used mainly to produce milk for domestic consumers, buffalo meat in particular has made India one of the top global exporters of red meat.6
